item.title: 美国政府关门：美国政府关门：如何影响关键经济数据的发布
item.description: 由于共和党和民主党未能达成协议，将拨款延长至 9 月 30 日联邦财政年度结束之后，美国政府于 10 月 1 日关闭了大部分业务。【原文：The U.S. government shut down much of its operations on October 1 after Republicans and Democrats failed to reach an agreement to extend funding past the end of the federal fiscal year on September 30.】

item.title: 古驰（Gucci）为 Demna 设计时装的快速通道初显成效
item.description: 数据显示，古驰（Gucci）在新设计师德姆纳（Demna）的首个系列中采用 "即看即买 "的方式，利用品牌的热度来吸引购物者在多年销售低迷之后重回店铺。【原文：Gucci's "see now, buy now" approach for the first collection from new designer Demna, harnessing a buzz around the brand to draw shoppers back to its stores after years of lackluster sales, is showing some early success, data shows.】

item.title: 特斯拉预告周二举行活动，重点转向经济型电动汽车
item.description: 特斯拉周日预告将于 10 月 7 日举行发布会，投资者和分析师正等待一款更经济实惠的车型来维持销售势头。【原文：Tesla on Sunday teased an October 7 event, as investors and analysts await a more affordable model to sustain sales momentum.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，波音准备最快在 10 月份提高 737 的产量
item.description: 彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）周一援引熟悉该计划的人士的话报道称，波音公司正在指导供应商提高 737 Max 的产量，最早可在 10 月份达到每月 42 架的节奏。【原文：Boeing is guiding suppliers that it could ramp up 737 Max output and could reach a 42-jet monthly tempo as early as October, Bloomberg News reported on Monday citing people familiar with the plans.】

item.title: 在特朗普征收关税的影响下，越南9月份对美鞋类出口下降27
item.description: 据周一公布的海关数据显示，9月份越南对美国的鞋类出口额骤降27%，降至6.11亿美元，是美国政府实施关税后所有行业中降幅最大的。【原文：Vietnam's footwear exports to the United States plunged 27% in September to $611 million, marking the steepest decline among all sectors following the implementation of tariffs by the U.S. government, according to customs data released Monday.】

item.title: 达契亚以 1.5 万欧元微型车原型挑战中国低成本电动汽车
item.description: 雷诺旗下的低成本品牌达契亚（Dacia）周一推出了一款电动微型车原型，售价可能低于15,000欧元（合17,625美元），有可能成为中国低成本电动车的竞争替代品。【原文：Renault's low-cost brand Dacia on Monday unveiled a prototype electric mini-car that could cost less than 15,000 euros ($17,625), potentially providing a competitive alternative to low-cost Chinese electric vehicles.】

item.title: BBVA 首席执行官表示，如有必要，BBVA 有 80 亿欧元资金可用于强制收购萨瓦德尔（Sabadell）。
item.description: BBVA 首席执行官奥努尔-根茨（Onur Genc）表示，如果 BBVA 无法说服足够多的小型竞争对手股东接受其恶意收购要约，BBVA 将有 80 亿欧元（94 亿美元）的资金用于对萨瓦德尔（Sabadell）的强制现金收购要约。【原文：BBVA has 8 billion euros ($9.4 billion) in capital for a mandatory cash offer for Sabadell should it fail to convince enough of its smaller rival's shareholders to accept its hostile offer, Chief Executive Officer Onur Genc said.】

item.title: 中国如何在菲律宾发动针对美国利益的信息战
item.description: 2021 年 11 月，中国船只在南海向菲律宾船只发射水炮，当时的北京驻马尼拉大使在 Facebook 上请菲律宾人分享他们最喜欢的中国事物。【原文：As Chinese ships fired water cannons at Philippine vessels in the South China Sea in November 2021, Beijing's then-ambassador to Manila asked Filipinos on Facebook to share their favorite things about China.】

item.title: 日本股市飙升 4%，比特币与黄金跃升至历史新高，政治震荡市场
item.description: 周一，日本股市大涨逾 4%，创下历史新高，而日元则在财政和货币鸽派人物高市真奈当选执政党领袖，有望成为日本首位女首相后出现下滑。【原文：Japanese stocks surged more than 4% to an all-time high while the yen skidded on Monday after fiscal and monetary dove Sanae Takaichi was elected as leader of the ruling party, putting her on course to become the nation's first female prime minister.】

item.title: 高市胜选刺激财政宽松押注，日元下挫
item.description: 周一早盘，日元兑美元汇率创下五个月来最大跌幅，此前真荣孝一在周末举行的自民党领导层选举中获胜，使日本走上了实施更多扩张性财政政策的道路，也使日本央行面临的任务变得更加复杂。【原文：The yen tumbled against the U.S. dollar by the most in five months in early trading on Monday after Sanae Takaichi won the LDP leadership election at the weekend, setting the country on course for more expansionary fiscal policy and complicating the task facing the Bank of Japan.】

item.title: 财政鸽派高市赢得大选后，日本日经指数飙升至创纪录水平
item.description: 在财政鸽派人士佐佐江-高市（Sanae Takaichi）当选执政党领袖并成为下一任首相后，日本日经指数周一首次突破 46,000 点。【原文：Japan's Nikkei share gauge surged past the 46,000 level for the first time on Monday after fiscal dove Sanae Takaichi was elected to lead the ruling party and become the next prime minister.】

item.title: 特朗普呼吁房利美和房地美让大型住宅建筑商 "动起来
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周日敦促美国抵押贷款融资公司房利美（Fannie Mae）和房地美（Freddie Mac）"让大型住宅建筑商们振作起来"，并在未提供证据的情况下称美国建筑商们 "坐拥 200 万块空地，创下历史记录"。【原文：President Donald Trump on Sunday urged U.S. mortgage financing companies Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to "get Big Homebuilders going," saying without providing evidence that U.S. builders were "sitting on 2 Million empty lots, a RECORD."】

item.title: 欧佩克+温和增产后，油价开盘上涨约 1
item.description: 周一开盘，油价上涨约 1%，此前欧佩克+组织宣布将从 11 月份起将产量提高 13.7 万桶/日，与 10 月份的月度增幅相同，而市场对供应过剩的担忧仍在持续。【原文：Oil prices rose about 1% at the start of trading on Monday after OPEC+ announced it would raise production from November by 137,000 barrels per day (bpd), the same modest monthly increase as in October, amid persistent worries over a looming supply glut.】

item.title: Firefly Aerospace 公司将以 8.55 亿美元收购 SciTec 公司
item.description: 太空技术公司 Firefly Aerospace 周日表示，它将以约 8.55 亿美元的现金和股票交易收购国家安全技术公司 SciTec。【原文：Space technology firm Firefly Aerospace said on Sunday that it will acquire national security technology company SciTec for about $855 million in a cash and stock deal.】

item.title: 罗马呼吁美国重新考虑对意大利面进口征收额外关税
item.description: 意大利外交部表示，罗马正与欧盟委员会密切合作，敦促美国重新考虑对意大利面进口征收额外的反倾销关税，这将使意大利面的价格翻倍。【原文：Rome is working closely with the European Commission to press the United States to reconsider an additional anti-dumping tariff on pasta imports which would effectively double their price, the Italian foreign ministry said.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：壳牌美国高管称特朗普叫停风电项目损害投资
item.description: 壳牌美国公司总裁科莱特-赫斯提斯（Colette Hirstius）在周日发表的一篇报道中告诉《金融时报》，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普政府决定停止完全许可的海上风能项目，这对投资 "非常不利"。【原文：The decision by President Donald Trump administration to halt fully permitted offshore wind energy projects is "very damaging" to investment, President of Shell U.S. Colette Hirstius told the Financial Times in a report published on Sunday.】

item.title: 消息人士称欧佩克+准备进一步提高石油产量
item.description: 接近会谈的消息人士称，欧佩克+将在周日举行的会议上进一步提高石油产量，沙特阿拉伯将推动更大幅度的增产，以重新夺回市场份额，而俄罗斯则建议小幅增产。【原文：OPEC+ will increase oil output further from November when it meets on Sunday, sources close to the talks said, with Saudi Arabia pushing for a larger increase to regain market share and Russia suggesting a more modest rise.】

item.title: 富士康第三季度营收同比增长 11
item.description: 全球最大的合约电子制造商、英伟达（Nvidia）最大的服务器制造商台湾富士康周日发布报告称，其第三季度收入同比增长 11%。【原文：Taiwan's Foxconn , the world's largest contract electronics maker and Nvidia's biggest server maker, reported on Sunday that its third-quarter revenue jumped 11% year on year.】

item.title: 比特币创下历史新高，突破 125,000 美元
item.description: 比特币是全球市值最大的加密货币，周日创下历史新高，格林尼治标准时间0512时，比特币上涨约2.68%，报125245.57美元。【原文：Bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency by market value, hit an all-time on Sunday and was up by around 2.68% at $125,245.57 at 0512 GMT.】

item.title: 高市胜任日本领导人可能会推迟而非阻止日本央行加息
item.description: 高市在竞选中脱颖而出，成为唯一支持大额支出和宽松货币政策的人。【原文：Takaichi stood out in the race as the only proponent of big spending and loose monetary policy.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，汽车制造商 Stellantis 计划在美国投资 100 亿美元
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周六援引熟知内情的人士的话报道，欧洲汽车制造商 Stellantis 计划在美国投资约 100 亿美元。【原文：European automaker Stellantis is planning to invest about $10 billion in the United States, Bloomberg News reported on Saturday, citing people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 厄瓜多尔撤销加拿大 DPM 公司开发黄金项目的环境许可证
item.description: 厄瓜多尔政府周六表示，已吊销加拿大矿业公司 DPM Metals 在环境敏感地区开发 Loma Larga 黄金项目的环境许可证。【原文：Ecuador's government has revoked the environmental license granted to Canadian mining company DPM Metals for the development of Loma Larga, a gold project in an environmentally sensitive area, the government said on Saturday.】

item.title: 执政党称赢得地方选举，格鲁吉亚警察与抗议者发生冲突
item.description: 一群示威者游行至总统府，在试图闯入大楼后被警察击退。【原文：A group of demonstrators marched to the presidential palace and were repelled by police after attempting to break into the building.】

item.title: 文件显示，德国联盟伙伴寻求保护欧洲钢铁业
item.description: 路透社周六看到的一份文件显示，德国总理弗里德里希-默茨（Friedrich Merz）联盟的小伙伴--德国社会民主党（Social Democrats）将推动对欧洲钢铁业采取更加保护主义的立场，敦促欧盟采取 "购买欧洲 "战略。【原文：Germany's Social Democrats, junior partners in Chancellor Friedrich Merz's coalition, will push for a more protectionist stance on Europe's steel industry, urging the EU to adopt a "buy European" strategy, a document seen by Reuters on Saturday showed.】

item.title: 日本日经指数创下新高，日元和债券因高市获胜而大幅下跌
item.description: 在财政鸽派人士高市真奈上周六当选执政党领袖并有可能出任首相之后，日本股市有望继续刷新纪录，即便该国货币和债券大幅下跌。【原文：Japanese shares are expected to keep setting records even as the nation's currency and bonds sputter after fiscal dove Sanae Takaichi was elected on Saturday to lead the ruling party and likely become prime minister.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，OpenAI 的 Altman 在亚洲和中东之行中寻求资金用于基础设施扩建
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周六援引熟悉会议情况的消息人士的话报道，OpenAI 首席执行官山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）已经开始了一项横跨东亚和中东地区的全球筹资计划，寻求融资和制造合作伙伴，以满足公司对计算能力的需求。【原文：OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has embarked on a global fundraising initiative spanning East Asia and the Middle East, seeking financing and manufacturing partners to meet the company's demand for its computing capacity, the Wall Street Journal reported on Saturday, citing sources familiar with the meetings.】

item.title: 日本高市认为有必要实现由需求驱动的通胀
item.description: 日本可能的下任首相佐佐江隆一周六表示，政府和央行必须密切合作，确保经济在工资和企业利润增长的支持下实现由需求驱动的通胀。【原文：Japan's likely next prime minister, Sanae Takaichi, said on Saturday the government and central bank must work closely to ensure the economy achieves demand-driven inflation backed by rising wages and corporate profits.】

item.title: 法国通讯报道：雷诺计划裁减 3,000 个支持性职位
item.description: 据法国通讯《L'Informe》周六报道，法国汽车制造商雷诺计划通过对支持职能部门员工的自愿裁员方案裁减 3000 个工作岗位。【原文：French carmaker Renault plans to cut 3,000 jobs through a voluntary redundancy offer for staff in support functions, French newsletter L'Informe reported on Saturday.】

item.title: OpenAI 将加强内容所有者对 Sora AI 视频应用程序的控制，并计划实现货币化
item.description: ChatGPT 的创造者 OpenAI 不久将推出控制措施，允许内容版权所有者决定如何在其人工智能视频生成工具 Sora 中使用其角色，并计划与允许使用这些角色的用户分享收入。【原文：ChatGPT creator OpenAI will soon introduce controls allowing the owners of content rights to dictate how their characters are used in its AI video-generating tool Sora and plans to share revenue with those who permit such use.】

item.title: 乔治-克鲁尼说，特朗普应为电影业制定激励措施，而不是关税
item.description: 电影明星乔治-克鲁尼（George Clooney）周五表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁要对所有海外生产的电影征收100%的关税，这是解决实际问题的错误方案。【原文：Movie star George Clooney said on Friday that U.S. President Donald Trump's threat to impose a 100% tariff on all films produced overseas was the wrong solution for a real issue.】
